page.title: 11NATURAL HISTORY
page.content: Chittening Warth, the long grass field that borders the Severn holds what is probably the greatest number of the larger species of waders in Avon; less of the smaller species are found except curlew and redshank. Owls winter there, larks and pipits nest and there is a good warbler population. Inland construction work is at a minimal and much of the area is fenced for security reasons so the birds and small mammals are on the increase. The many hedgerows and rhines provide good habitats for the more common wild flowers and butterflies.
